result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick A Russell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick A Russell appeared by video.  Attorney Dean Douglas Sopcic appeared by video for Derrick A Russell.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant completed a TAD evaluation and is requesting a DPA hearing. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick A Russell appeared by video.  Attorney Dean Douglas Sopcic appeared by video for Derrick A Russell.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Signature bond continued.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Derrick A Russell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 10-03-2022 at 08:30 AM, Branch 30.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Derrick A Russell not in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for calendar call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Derrick A Russell not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for pre-trial conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 30  Calendar call scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derrick A Russell in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-21-2022 @1p
